title: Your Monday Briefing: Arms Race in Asia
description: Also, Putin’s nuclear brinkmanship and a rift in the Israeli government.

title: Israel’s Government Speeds Judicial Overhaul Despite Defense Minister’s Plea
description: Lawmakers worked at a frenzied pace to finalize the text of a proposal that would give the government greater control over the selection of Supreme Court judges.

title: History in the Rubble
description: Documenting the damage of last month’s earthquakes in Turkey.

title: Putin Says He Could Put Tactical Nuclear Weapons in Belarus by Summer
description: The proposal from President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, talked of since last year, would be provocative without changing the West’s battlefield calculus.

title: Wagner Fighters Left as Convicts. Will Russia Bury Them as Heroes?
description: As thousands of ex-prisoners fight and die in Ukraine, honoring their memory is becoming a patriotic imperative in Russia. But some committed crimes their old neighbors cannot forget.

title: In China, Marriage Rates Are Down and ‘Bride Prices’ Are Up
description: China’s one-child policy has led to too few women. Grooms are now paying more money for wives, in a tradition that has faced growing resistance.

title: Honduras Switches Relations to China, a Blow to Taiwan
description: The decision by Honduras is also a setback in Washington’s efforts to use its influence in Central America to help prevent China from isolating Taiwan.
